result.execSummary:
The defendant Darius L Belle was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Conceal (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(d).
  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Conceal (<=$500) AMENDED FROM Intentionally Conceal (>$500 - $5000) [Modifiers: Habitual Criminality], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Expungement to be granted upon successful completion of probation.

miscConds.notes: Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law.  Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Attend school daily and obtain GED or HSED.
No alcohol or controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

Defendant is ordered to pay restitution during the pendancy of probation.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

supervisions.notes:
Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 2 years bifurcated sentence.
Consecutive to: to time now serving

superMiscConds.notes: No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances, except for those prescribed by treating health care provider.  Submit to random testing as required by agent.  Cooperate with AODA assessment and follow through with treatment, counseling and program recommendations.  Attend 5 self-help meetings per week and provide verification of attendant to agent weekly.

Pay all unpaid court costs and fees orderd at sentencing January 26, 2016.    If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.Cooperate with counseling, treatment and programs determined appropriate.  Follow through with recommendations.  Provide DNA sample, if required, and pay assessed surcharge.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: to time now serving

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

supervisions.notes: **AMENDED 1-26-2016:  To clarify the proper penalty enhancer statute.**

AMENDED 08-11-2016 TO CORRECT THIS COUNT TO READ 'CONCURRENT WITH CTS 1 & 2'
Concurrent with: with Cts 1 & 2

charges.descr: Retail Theft - Intentionally Conceal (<=$500) AMENDED FROM Intentionally Conceal (>$500 - $5000)

records.addlTxt: From DOC re: clarification of ct 3 to cts 1 and 2
From defendant re: Would like to be eligible for CIP/SAP. Fwd to Judge for review.
Per RASO - defendant has been transferred to the prison system

Defendant Darius L Belle in court with attorney James J. Ermert.  Defendant Darius L Belle in custody.  Bridget D. Brave appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Court Reporter:  Rose Coulthart.  Revocation packet has been received and reviewed by all parties.  There are no additions or corrections to the revocation order and warrant.  State recommends 18 mo wps and 6 mo ES on each charge concurrent.  This is a stipulated agreement.  The pictures that caused the revocation process are not available to the court at this time.  Defendant is serving consecutive time and has 3 more months to serve on those matters.  Parties request that this case be served concurrent to those matters.  

BTC:  Ct. 1- 2 yrs wps: 18 months wps and 6 mo es  cons. to time now serving
           Ct. 2- 2 yrs wps: 18 months wps and 6 mo es cons to ct. 1 and any other sentence
           Ct. 3- 2 yrs wps: 18 months wps and 6 mo es conc. to ct. 2
Conditions:  
no drugs or alco.  Random tests to verify no use.  
attend 5 self help meetings per week and turn in signed verification of attendance to agent
assessment and counseling as deemed appropriate by the agent
supervision fees
court cost owed must be paid
DNA sample and pay for testing

5/19/16:  PER JUDGE:  DEF NOT ELIGIBLE FOR CIP OR SAP
Sentencing hearing on revocation on May 3, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Restitition ordered attend school everyday and obtain diploma  no alco or c/s monitoring  CC and assessments including DNA  if successfully completes probation expungment is granted.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:   Defendant to be placed on GPS monitor through Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI), 524 Main Street, 3rd floor, (262-632-1780). Exception meeting with Atty and court  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any  alcohol.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  No contact with victim store except for restitution purposes. Pic N Save and Boston Store  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
